examples: I retain this drug for a long time

results.definition: allow to remain in a place or position or maintain a property or feature
examples: We cannot continue several servants any longer
The family's fortune waned and they could not keep their household staff
Our grant has run out and we cannot keep you on
We kept the work going as long as we could
this garment retains its shape even after many washings

results.definition: secure and keep for possible future use or application
examples: The landlord retained the security deposit
I reserve the right to disagree
I cannot retain so much information

results.definition: continued in your keeping or use or memory
examples: in...the retained pattern of dancers and guests remembered
